meanings.definition: A tool used to help slide shoes onto the feet.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's shoehorns make putting on shoes easier.
meanings.sent2: I keep a shoehorn in my closet to assist with my boots.
meanings.sent3: The shoehorns in the store were colorful and fun to use.
meanings.sent4: His shoehorns were like magic wands for slipping into shoes effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The shiny shoehorn gleamed as it helped with the snug fit of the shoe.

meanings.definition: To force or squeeze something into a tight space.
meanings.sent1: I had to shoehorn my suitcase into the overhead compartment.
meanings.sent2: He tried to shoehorn the last piece of the puzzle into place.
meanings.sent3: She managed to shoehorn all her clothes into the tiny suitcase.
meanings.sent4: The team had to shoehorn the large sofa through the narrow doorway.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to shoehorn all the ingredients into the small pot.
